SecondaryPrelims.Title: The Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) (Amendment) Regulations 2003

Para.Text: The Secretary of State for Transport, being a Minister designated for the purposes of section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 in relation to the regulation of the type, description, construction or equipment of vehicles and of components of vehicles, and in particular any vehicle type approval scheme, in exercise of the powers conferred by that section and of all other powers enabling him in that behalf, hereby makes the following Regulations:

P2para.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) (Amendment) Regulations 2003.
This regulation and regulation 2(f) shall come into force on 7th May 2003 and all other regulations shall come into force on 9th November 2003.

P1group.Title: Amendment of the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999

P1para.Text: The Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999 shall be amended in accordance with the following paragraphs—

P3para.Text: in regulation 3 (interpretation)—

P4para.Text: for the definition of “the Framework Directive” there shall be substituted the following—

Para.Text: “the Framework Directive” means Directive 2002/24/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18th March 2002 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheel motor vehicles and repealing Council Directive 92/61/EEC, as corrected by a Corrigendum;

P4para.Text: in the definition of “EC component type approval” after “approval of a” there shall be inserted “system,”;
for the definition of “moped” there shall be substituted—

Para.Text: “moped” means a two or three wheel vehicle with a maximum design speed of not more than 45 km/h which—
if a two wheel vehicle, is fitted with an engine which—
in the case of the internal combustion type, has a cylinder capacity not exceeding 50 cm; and
in the case of an electric motor, has a maximum continuous rated power of not more than 4 kW; and
if a three wheel vehicle, is fitted with an engine which—
in the case of the spark (positive) ignition type, has a cylinder capacity not exceeding 50 cm;
in the case of an internal combustion type other than of the spark (positive) ignition type, has a maximum net power output not exceeding 4 kW; and
in the case of an electric motor, has a maximum continuous rated power of not more than 4 kW;

P4para.Text: in the definition of “quadricycle”, in paragraph (a), for “less than 350 kg” there shall be substituted “not more than 350 kg”;

P3para.Text: in regulation 4 (vehicles to which the regulations apply) in paragraph (2)—

P4para.Text: in sub-paragraph (d) for “whatever the terrain” there shall be substituted “in off-road conditions”; and
after sub-paragraph (f) there shall be added—

P3para.Text: cycles with pedal assistance which are equipped with an auxiliary electric motor having a maximum continuous rated power of 0.25 kW, of which the output is progressively reduced and finally cut off as the vehicle reaches a speed of 25 km/h, or sooner, if the cyclist stops pedalling.
after regulation 10 (duty to co-operate with the Secretary of State) there shall be inserted—

P2para.Text: The holder of an EC type approval granted by the Secretary of State shall comply with the following requirements of Article 9 of the Framework Directive—

P3para.Text: the second sentence of paragraph (1); and
the first sentence of paragraph (4).

P2para.Text: For the purposes of the said Article 9 the Secretary of State is designated as the competent authority and as the approval authority.

P3para.Text: after regulation 18 (prototypes) there shall be inserted—

P2para.Text: This regulation applies to an EC type approval if—

P3para.Text: it has been granted by the Secretary of State or under any provision of the law of an EEA State other than the United Kingdom giving effect to Article 4 of the Framework Directive; and
the Secretary of State is satisfied that it is going to cease to have effect in consequence of the provisions of the Framework Directive or a separate Directive.

P2para.Text: Subject to paragraph (3) the Secretary of State may, at the request of the holder of an EC type approval to which this regulation applies, direct that every relevant EC certificate of conformity shall continue to have effect for the purpose of—

P3para.Text: Part II of the 1988 Act,
Part IV of the 1981 Order, and
this Part of these Regulations,

P2para.Text: for the period of 12 months as from the date on which the EC type approval lost its validity.
A request under paragraph (2) shall specify the technical or economic reasons for which it is made.
A direction under paragraph (2)—

P3para.Text: may be given only at a time when the EC type approval has effect;
shall cease to have effect if the EC type approval—

P4para.Text: is withdrawn under any provision of the law of an EEA State other than the United Kingdom giving effect to Article 4 of the Framework Directive, or
ceases to have effect for a reason other than that referred to in sub-paragraph (1)(b), and

P3para.Text: shall have effect subject to regulations 14(6) and (10) and 16.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (2), an EC certificate of conformity is a relevant EC certificate of conformity where—

P3para.Text: the EC type approval pursuant to which it is issued ceases to have effect;
it was issued not less than three months before the EC type approval ceases to have effect; and
the vehicle to which it relates is an end of series vehicle.

P2para.Text: If, following a request by a holder of an EC type approval, the Secretary of State refuses to exercise his powers under paragraph (2), he shall give notice of his decision to the holder.
In this regulation “end of series vehicle” has the meaning given in Schedule 1A.

P3para.Text: in regulation 26 (transitional) after paragraph (2) there shall be added—

P2para.Text: An application for EC type approval made under these Regulations before amendment by the Amending Regulations shall have effect as if made under these Regulations as amended by those Regulations.
Regulations 7 to 16 and 20—

P3para.Text: shall apply to the type approval, granted pursuant to Directive 92/61/EEC, of a separate technical unit or component, or of a vehicle, as they apply to an EC type approval; and
shall apply to a type approval certificate issued—

P4para.Text: under regulation 7 of these Regulations before amendment by the Amending Regulations, or
under any provision of the law of an EEA State other than the United Kingdom giving effect to Article 5 of Directive 92/61/EEC,

P3para.Text: as they apply to an EC type approval certificate.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of this regulation—

Para.Text: “the Amending Regulations” means the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) (Amendment) Regulations 2003; and
“Directive 92/61/EEC” means Council Directive 92/61/EEC of 30th June 1992 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheel motor vehicles.

P3para.Text: in Schedule 1 (Separate Directives)—

P5para.Text: in the third and fourth columns respectively there shall be inserted at the end—
in the entry in the fifth column after “and maximum” there shall be inserted “net”; and

P4para.Text: in relation to item 12 in the third column and fourth columns respectively there shall be inserted at the end—

P3para.Text: after Schedule 2 there shall be inserted the content of the Schedule to these Regulations; and
in Schedule 2 (Amendments of Acts and Orders) paragraph 4(2)(b) shall be omitted.

P1group.Title: Amendment of the Road Traffic Act 1988

P1para.Text: In the Road Traffic Act 1988 in section 85 (interpretation of Part II)—

P3para.Text: in the definition of “EC certificate of conformity”, for paragraph (b) there shall be substituted—

Para.Text: in the case of a vehicle to which the motorcycle type approval Directive applies, any certificate of conformity—
issued by a manufacturer under regulation 8(1) of the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999, whether before, on or after 9th November 2003, or

issued by a manufacturer under any provision of the law of an EEA State other than the United Kingdom giving effect to Article 7(1) of the motorcycle type approval directive or to Article 7(1) of Council Directive 92/61/EEC of 30th June 1992 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheeled motor vehicles,

P3para.Text: for the definition of “the motorcycle type approval Directive” there shall be substituted—

Para.Text: “the motorcycle type approval Directive” means Directive 2002/24/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18th March 2002 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheel motor vehicles and repealing Council Directive 92/61/EEC, as corrected by a Corrigendum of 22nd February 2003,

P1group.Title: Amendment of the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 1981

P1para.Text: In the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 in article 31A in paragraph 7—

P3para.Text: in the definition of “EC certificate of conformity”, for paragraph (b) there shall be substituted—

Para.Text: in the case of a vehicle to which the motorcycle type approval Directive applies, any certificate of conformity—
issued by a manufacturer under regulation 8(1) of the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999, whether before, on or after 9th November 2003, or

issued by a manufacturer under any provision of the law of an EEA State other than the United Kingdom giving effect to Article 7(1) of the motorcycle type approval directive or to Article 7(1) of Council Directive 92/61/EEC of 30th June 1992 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheeled motor vehicles,

P3para.Text: for the definition of “the motorcycle type approval Directive” there shall be substituted—

Para.Text: “the motorcycle type approval Directive” means Directive 2002/24/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18th March 2002 relating to the type approval of two or three-wheel motor vehicles and repealing Council Directive 92/61/EEC, as corrected by a Corrigendum of 22nd February 2003;
Signed by authority of the Secretary of State for Transport

TitleBlock.Title: MEANING OF END OF SERIES VEHICLE

P2para.Text: A vehicle is an end of series vehicle for an EC type approval to which regulation 18A applies if—

P3para.Text: an EC certificate of conformity has been issued in respect of the vehicle under the EC type approval (whether before or after the giving of the direction by the Secretary of State);
the vehicle was in the territory of an EEA State at a time when the EC type approval had effect;
it was manufactured with the intention that it should be supplied by retail for use in the United Kingdom;
it was not registered under the 1994 Act on the date on which the relevant EC type approval ceased to have effect; and
it is a vehicle forming part of the allocation of vehicles to a relevant person under sub-paragraphs (2) and (3) of this paragraph.

P2para.Text: The Secretary of State shall make an allocation in accordance with sub-paragraph (3) to each relevant person who makes a request to him under regulation 18A(2) not later than one month before the relevant EC type approval ceases to have effect.
The Secretary of State shall allocate to each relevant person in respect of each vehicle model manufactured in conformity with the relevant EC type approval—

P3para.Text: the number of vehicles of that model in respect of which the request is made, or

the number of vehicles of that model for which an EC certificate of conformity was issued on or after the date of manufacture and which remained valid for at least 3 months after its date of issue but subsequently lost its validity because of the provisions of the Framework Directive or a separate Directive,

P2para.Text: whichever is the less.
In this Schedule—

Para.Text: “date of manufacture” means, in relation to a vehicle, the date on which its final assembly is completed;
“relevant person” means a person who has made a request to the Secretary of State under regulation 18A(2);
“the relevant EC type approval” means the EC type approval in respect of which the request has been made to the Secretary of State under regulation 18A(2).
(This note is not part of the Regulations)

P.Text: These Regulations amend provisions of the Motor Cycles Etc. (EC Type Approval) Regulations 1999 (“the principal Regulations”) in implementation of Directive 2002/24/EC which replaces Directive 92/61/EC (OJ No. L225, 10.8.92, p.72) as the framework directive for European Community type approval of motor cycles, other vehicles and their components (regulation 2, save for paragraph (f)) and make amendments to the Road Traffic Act 1988 and the Road Traffic (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 (regulations 3 and 4).

The Regulations also amend Schedule 1 to the principal Regulations to correct an error and to include Commission Directive 2002/41/EC and Directive 2002/51/EC of the European Parliament and Council as separate directives amending, respectively, Directive 95/1/EC on the maximum design speed, maximum torque and maximum net engine power of two or three wheeled motor vehicles (OJ No. L52, 8.3.95, p.1) and Directive 97/24/EC of the European Parliament and Council on certain components and characteristics of two or three-wheel motor vehicles (OJ No. L226, 18.8.97, p.1) (regulation 2(f)).

A Transposition Note has been prepared setting out how these Regulations will transpose into UK law the provisions of Directive 2002/24/EC in so far as the obligations therein will not be given effect by the principal Regulations.

Copies of the Directives referred to in the Regulations may be obtained from the Stationery Office. Copies of the Transposition Note are available from the Vehicle Certification Agency, 1 The Eastgate Office Centre, Eastgate Road, Bristol, BS5 6XX (Telephone number: 0117 9524106; fax number: 0117 9524104). Access to copies of the Note can also be obtained by visiting the Vehicle Certification Agency’s website at www.vca.gov.uk.
